name: df-spliceOLD
body: |- wceq(cspliceOLD, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, co(co(co(cv(s0), csubstr, cop(nat0, cfv(c1st, cfv(c1st, cv(s1))))), cconcat, cfv(c2nd, cv(s1))), cconcat, co(cv(s0), csubstr, cop(cfv(c2nd, cfv(c1st, cv(s1))), cfv(chash, cv(s0)))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ spliceOLD =(s0 âˆˆ ğ•Œ, s1 âˆˆ ğ•Œ â†¦(((s0[substr]< 0,(1st `(1st ` s1))>)[++](2nd ` s1))[++](s0[substr]<(2nd `(1st ` s1)),(# ` s0)>)))
comment: Obsolete version of ~ df-splice as of 12-Oct-2022. Define an operation which replaces portions of words. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 15-Aug-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)
